intro: Barleria mackenii, commonly known as the blue barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Barleria mackenii is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
